channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: JPMorgan begins suing customers who allegedly stole thousands of dollars in 'infinite money glitch'
item.description: JPMorgan is investigating thousands of cases related to the glitch, which highlights the risk that social media can amplify vulnerabilities found at a bank.

item.title: Apple releases Apple Intelligence. Here's how to get it on your iPhone
item.description: The release is a critical milestone for Apple, which is relying on the feature launch to power its marketing campaign for the iPhone 16.

item.title: U.S. oil posts worst day in two years after Israel spares Iran crude facilities
item.description: Oil prices lost ground on Monday after Iranian energy facilities were spared during an Israeli attack over the weekend.

item.title: Volkswagen targets layoffs and 10% pay cuts amid plans for German plant closures, union says
item.description: Volkswagen is considering wide spread pay cuts and layoffs as well as closures or size reductions of its plants in Germany, the company's works council said Monday.

item.title: Trump Media shares surge up to 20% after Trump rally in New York City
item.description: Shares of Donald Trump's social media company rocketed up as much as 20% Monday morning.

item.title: Harris dismisses Tony Hinchcliffe 'nonsense' about Puerto Rico at Trump MSG rally
item.description: Democratic presidential nominee Kamala Harris said GOP nominee Donald Trump is "fixated on his grievances, on himself and on dividing our country."

item.title: Philadelphia DA sues Elon Musk PAC to stop $1 million lottery for voters
item.description: Elon Musk and his America PAC, who are backing Donald Trump, have offered registered voters in swing states the chance to win $1 million each day.

item.title: Election win for Russia-friendly party in Georgia sets the stage for protests and possible violence
item.description: Mass protests are expected in the Georgian capital of Tbilisi after the ruling, Russia-friendly party Georgian Dream claimed victory in a contentious election.

item.title: Manchester United sack manager Erik ten Hag after dismal start to the season
item.description: Manchester United sacked Erik ten Hag as the club's first-team manager on Monday following a dismal start to the Premier League season.

item.title: F1 championships are increasingly being decided by how teams use new technology
item.description: With the cost-cap limiting budgets to $135 million per year, automating repetitive tasks is crucial to ensuring teams are using their resources efficiently.

item.title: Apple announces new iMac with M4 chip, starts at $1,299
item.description: Apple on Monday announced an updated iMac with the company's latest M4 chip.

item.title: Wise's billionaire CEO fined £350,000 by UK regulators over failure to report tax issue
item.description: Kristo Käärmann, CEO and co-founder of Wise, was ordered by regulators to pay a £350,000 fine due to a breach of senior manager conduct rules.

item.title: Robinhood jumps into election trading, giving users chance to buy Harris or Trump contracts
item.description: Users can trade a Kamala Harris or Donald Trump contract starting Monday.

item.title: Japan's central bank to remain undeterred on rate hikes despite LDP's electoral shock, analysts say
item.description: Roughly 86% of economists polled by Reuters expect the central bank to leave its rates unchanged when it announces its decision Thursday.

item.title: Foreign investors flock to flagship Saudi economic conference — but face less free-flowing cash
item.description: Thousands of financiers, founders and investors are set to descend on the Saudi capital of Riyadh for the eighth edition of the kingdom's Future Investment Initiative.

item.title: Britain's Labour government to deliver debut Budget this week, settling weeks of uncertainty
item.description: U.K. Finance Minister Rachel Reeves will deliver the government's hotly awaited debut budget on Wednesday, putting to bed weeks of uncertainty over potential tax hikes and spending cuts.

item.title: China's industrial profits plunge at fastest pace since the pandemic
item.description: The country's industrial profits declined 27.1% year-on-year in September.

item.title: Vietnam waits for major upgrade to its $200 billion stock market
item.description: Vietnam's chip capabilities have it competing against near neighbor Malaysia, attracting global semiconductor firms.

item.title: Olympus shares drop over 5% after CEO resigns over drug allegation
item.description: The stock slid 5.3% on the Tokyo Stock Exchange following news of Stefan Kaufmann's resignation.

item.title: Japan's Shigeru Ishiba suggests he intends to stay on as PM after ruling coalition loses majority
item.description: It is the first time since 2009 that the Liberal Democratic Party has lost its parliamentary majority.

item.title: McDonald's Quarter Pounder burgers to return to restaurants affected by E. coli outbreak
item.description: The Colorado Department of Agriculture's testing did not detect E. coli in samples of the beef patties taken from McDonald's restaurants in the area.

item.title: Biden says Elon Musk was an 'illegal worker' when he began U.S. career
item.description: Elon Musk has become a regular campaign surrogate for Donald Trump in the presidential race against Vice President Kamala Harris.

item.title: Trump doubles down on replacing income taxes with tariffs in Joe Rogan interview
item.description: Vice President Kamala Harris has attacked the tariff policy proposed by Donald Trump, calling it effectively a "sales tax" on Americans.

item.title: CNBC Daily Open: Nasdaq hits high even as poor earnings growth disappoints investors
item.description: Even though almost three-quarters of S&P companies have beaten expectations, according to FactSet data, the rate of profit growth has not met expectations.

item.title: Jeff Bezos killed Washington Post endorsement of Kamala Harris, paper reports
item.description: The Washington Post planned to endorse Kamala Harris over Donald Trump before owner Jeff Bezos, the Amazon founder, decided against it, the newspaper reported.

item.title: German finance minister warns of retaliation if U.S. kicks off trade war
item.description: German Finance Minister Christian Lindner on Friday warned that if the U.S. kicked off a trade war with the European Union, there could be retaliation.

item.title: Elon Musk's secret talks with Putin ramped up during his Twitter takeover: WSJ report
item.description: Tesla and SpaceX CEO Elon Musk has engaged in secret talks with Vladimir Putin since late 2022, The Wall Street Journal reports.

item.title: Delta sues CrowdStrike after widespread IT outage that caused thousands of cancellations
item.description: Delta is seeking damages for its losses from the July IT incident, as well as litigation costs and punitive damages.

item.title: What McDonald's needs to do next after E. coli outbreak
item.description: Health authorities are investigating the source of the E. coli outbreak that has sickened 75 and led to one death.

item.title: How United is trying to overtake Delta as the world's most profitable airline
item.description: United Airlines has been trying to expand its profits by investing heavily in roomier seats and growing a network that will excite high-spending travelers.
